verse: The word of Adonai came to me saying:
“You, son of man, lift up a lament for Tyre.
“‘Tarshish was your trading partner because of the abundance of all riches. With silver, iron, tin, and lead, they traded for your merchandise.
Javan, Tubal and Meshech were your traffickers—they gave lives of people and vessels of bronze for your wares.
Those from the house of Togarmah traded for your merchandise with horses, steeds and mules.
The men of Dedan traded with you; many coastlands were your customers; they brought you horns of ivory and ebony as your payment.
Aram was your customer because of your abundant goods—they traded for your merchandise with emerald, purple and embroidered cloth, fine linen, coral and rubies.
Judah and the land of Israel were your customers; they traded for your wares with wheat of Minnith, confections, honey, oil and balm.
Damascus was your customer because of the abundance of your goods and all your great wealth, with the wine of Helbon and wool of white.
Vedan and Javan from Uzal traded for your wares—ironwork, cinnamon and spices were bartered for your merchandise.
Dedan was your dealer in saddlecloth for riding.
Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your favored trading partners in lambs, rams and goats; in these they were your customers.
The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your vendors—they traded for your wares with the finest spices, all precious stones and gold.
Haran and Canneh and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur and Chilmad traded with you.
They traded for your merchandise with gorgeous fabrics, garments of blue and richly woven work, carpets of multi-colored material, with cords twisted and tightly knotted.
The ships of Tarshish serve as carriers for your wares.
